title.div: The Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Grantiau a Benthyciadau Dysgu y Cynulliad (Addysg Uwch) (Cymru) 2011

div.p: These Regulations provide for financial support for students who are ordinarily resident in Wales taking designated higher education courses in respect of academic years beginning on or after 1 September 2011. They consolidate, with some changes, the Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer cymorth ariannol i fyfyrwyr sy'n preswylio fel arfer yng Nghymru ac sy'n dilyn cyrsiau addysg uwch dynodedig mewn perthynas â blynyddoedd academaidd sy'n dechrau ar neu ar ôl 1 Medi 2011. Maent yn cydgrynhoi, gyda rhai newidiadau, Rheoliadau Grantiau a Benthyciadau Dysgu y Cynulliad (Addysg Uwch) (Cymru) 2009,(“Rheoliadau 2009”).

entry.title: The Control of Dogs (Scotland) Act 2010 (Prescribed Form of Notice) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order prescribes the form for a dog control notice which can be served under section1(1) of the Control of Dogs (Scotland) Act 2010. A notice in the prescribed form may be served by an authorised officer appointed by a local authority where a dog has been out of control. The notice sets out the reasons why an authorised officer considers the dog was out of control and specifies what steps the recipient of the notice must take to bring and keep the dog under control.

title.div: The Non-Domestic Rating (Unoccupied Property) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Ardrethu Annomestig (Eiddo Heb ei Feddiannu) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2011

div.p: Under section 45 of the Local Government Finance Act 1988 (“the 1988 Act”) non-domestic rates are payable on an unoccupied hereditament if it fulfils the conditions set out in section 45(1). Those conditions include a condition that the hereditament falls within a prescribed class.

O dan adran 45 o Ddeddf Cyllid Llywodraeth Leol 1988 (“Deddf 1988”) mae ardrethi annomestig yn daladwy ar hereditament sydd heb ei feddiannu os yw'n bodloni'r amodau a bennir yn adran 45(1). Mae'r amodau hynny'n cynnwys amod bod yr hereditament yn dod o fewn dosbarth rhagnodedig.

entry.title: The General Dental Council (Constitution of Committees) (Amendment) Rules Order of Council 2011

category.term: HEALTH CARE AND ASSOCIATED PROFESSIONS;DENTISTS, PROFESSIONS COMPLEMENTARY TO DENTISTRY

entry.summary: This Order approves the General Dental Council (Constitution of Committees) (Amendment) Rules 2010, which are scheduled to the Order.

entry.title: Rates (Amendment) (2009 Act) (Commencement No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the provisions of the Rates (Amendment) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009—

entry.title: The Uplands Transitional Payment Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations partially implement Council Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (OJ No L 277, 21.10.05, p1) on support for rural development by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and Council Regulation (EC) No 1257/1999 (OJ No L 160, 26.6.99, p80) on support for rural development from the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund (EAGGF), in so far as those Council Regulations relate to less favoured areas.

entry.title: The Debt Relief (2010 Act) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the provisions of the Debt Relief Act (Northern Ireland) 2010, in so far as not already in operation, on 30th June 2011

entry.title: The Legal Services Act 2007 (Disclosure of Restricted Information) Order 2011
entry.summary: Sections 152 and 168 of the Legal Services Act 2007 (c. 29) set out the circumstances in which the Office for Legal Complaints and the Legal Services Board respectively may disclose restricted information (information obtained in the exercise of their regulatory functions, principally during the investigation of a complaint). This Order specifies additional persons to whom the Office for Legal Complaints and the Legal Services Board may disclose restricted information and prescribes the purposes for which it may be disclosed.

entry.title: The Insolvency (Fees) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to the Insolvency (Fees) Order (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.R. 2006 No. 54) (“the principal Order”). It introduces a new fee to follow on from the introduction of debt relief orders into the Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 1989 (“the 1989 Order”) by the Debt Relief Act (Northern Ireland) 2010.

entry.title: The Charities (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation provisions of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 which confer regulatory, investigatory and enforcement powers on the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland (“the Commission”). The Order also commences provisions relating to recreational charities and sports clubs as well as all provisions relating to the Charity Tribunal for Northern Ireland which have not yet been commenced.

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rating (Collection and Enforcement) (Local Lists) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2011
Biomass Processing Challenge Fund (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Biomass Processing Challenge Fund Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010 (‘the principal Regulations’) to correct certain drafting errors.

entry.title: The Debt Relief Orders (Designation of Competent Authorities) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under Article 208U (approved intermediaries) of the Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 1989, inserted by the Debt Relief Act (Northern Ireland) 2010. That Act inserted a new Part 7A into the Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 1989 making provision for applications for, and making of, debt relief orders. An application for a debt relief order must be made to the official receiver through an approved intermediary. Approved intermediaries are individuals approved by a competent authority to act as an intermediary between a person wishing to make an application for a debt relief order and the official receiver. “Competent authority” means a body for the time being designated by the Department for the purposes of granting approvals to individuals to act as intermediaries

entry.title: The Charities Act 2008 (Transitional Provision) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional provision bringing Northern Ireland charities within the jurisdiction of the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland (“the Commission”) for the purposes of those provisions of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) commenced by the Charities (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011.

entry.title: The Water Framework Directive (Priority Substances and Classification) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Council Directive 2008/105/EC on environmental quality standards in the field of water policy (O.J. No. L348, 24.12.2008 p.84) and set out the classification schemes used under the implementation of Directive 2000/60/EC establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (O.J. No. L327, 22.12.2000 p.60).

entry.title: The Interests of Members of the Scottish Parliament Act 2006 (Modifications to the Schedule) Resolution 2011
The Social Care and Social Work Improvement Scotland (Requirements for Reports) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to reports prepared by Social Care and Social Work Improvement Scotland (SCSWIS) under section 57 of the Public Services Reform (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Healthcare Improvement Scotland (Requirements for Reports) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to reports prepared by Healthcare Improvement Scotland (HIS) under section 10N of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Proscribed Organisations) (Amendment) Order 2011
entry.summary: Part 2 of the Terrorism Act 2000 makes provision about proscribed organisations (including setting out offences in relation to such organisations in sections 11 to 13). An organisation is proscribed if it is listed in Schedule 2 to that Act or operates under the same name as an organisation so listed (section 3(1)). Article 2 of this Order adds “Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan” to the list in that Schedule.

entry.title: The Public Services Reform (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 13 of, and schedule 4 to, the Public Services Reform (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”) on the regulation of officers of court. Those provisions amend the Debtors (Scotland) Act 1987 (c.18) and the Bankruptcy and Diligence etc. (Scotland) Act 2007 to abolish the Scottish Civil Enforcement Commission and make other changes to the supervisory and regulatory structures for messengers-at-arms and sheriff officers.
